name: The Iron Warlock: Sorcerer 32 / Paladin 1 / Dwarven Defender 7
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Sometimes you just want a little strange.  I thought to myself, “Self, we need a challenge.  Let’s take a dwarf and add two classes that are least favorable, and then let’s give him a 20% xp penalty, and then let’s make sure we start him with an 8 Strength. Further, let’s get a 22 Con but take no more than 7 Dwarven Defender levels.  Yeah…. Let’s put that in our pipe, self, and smoke it.”
 
The result is a virtual Ion Cannon.  High saves, high hit points, 12/- damage reduction, and a near unending supply of tactical nuke rounds.  With the exception of autofail, he’s practically immune to Implosions and Wails and Dev Crit, he cannot be flanked or sneaked from the flanks, he can penetrate max toolset SR, maintains a high Concentration to ensure maximum sorcerous delivery, grabs Craft Wand for ultimate utility and, if all else fails, can turn on Epic Warding and let the moths draw hither.

Note: The above spell set is just a template.  As a sorcerer, you can discard spells that you no longer need on Level Ups and choose a new one.  I do this with utility spells and craft wands from those spells, and then discard those spells later in favor of a direct combat/defense spell.  Invisibility, Knock, Find Traps, Flame Weapon, Lesser Breach, Identify, etc, are all worthwhile candidates for spells you may choose at one point in your career, craft wands of these, and then cast off later.                                                                        
 
Builder’s Commentary
There are no builds in the Old Guild or the New using these classes, so this may be a first.  If one exists somewhere, Moderators, please provide credit to the author.  This build is a strange duck, to say the least.  At first glance one thinks, “What on earth?”  But when you get into the weeds he performs remarkably well and even has some RP potential.  This is not a DC caster.  He relies on direct damage spells and damage shields.  One might ask, “Why? Why even the DwD levels?  I just really wanted Defensive Awareness II, and once you get that at DwD5, one might as well go to DwD6 for 3/- DR.  The last DwD level is just to max out Spot.  Regarding skill point allocation: On Sorcerer Levels max Concentration and Spellcraft.  On Defender Levels max Concentration and Spot.  Drop your Tumble ranks (cross-classed) in between.  It should be noted that this is not a hit-me-mage, though that is a style he can adopt if needed.  I did want him to have some AC to mitigate criticals.  There is no discipline in the build, but you would only need to be concerned about Knockdown, so make sure to find that immunity if available.  Unlike other munchkin builds, paladin is taken early on to get those save bonuses up front.  This build was tested in the Halls of Advanced Training, and I’ll be giving him a whirl from the ground up out at me ole’ stompin’ grounds.  Thoughts and comments are welcome.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
@webshaman1 , Just to be clear to the lay reader/player, this is not a power build by any stretch of the imagination (I know you know this but others may not since you have a penchant for hyperbole).  On the contrary, any pure sorc or near pure sorcer (see Exalted variations) will outgun this Dwarven Warlock, both in PvM and PvP.  I think most variations of Mestil-type builds -- Half-Dead Juggernaut, Pale Emissary, etc -- are also superior to this one (but don't confuse superior with being able to beat him in PvP, for that is a different matter and one that I would be inclined to place money on this Warlock).  So this is not a power build and there are plenty of sorcerer builds, or hit-me-mages, that are superior in PvM.  This one is just a different, unique in some respects (there are very good reasons why one was never made or posted before), and illustrates that even after 20 years we can still come up with new concepts and variations.  

But it should also be noted that he is not immune to sneak attacks.  Indeed, he can be sneaked just like anyone else -- from stealthed, HiPSed, knockdowned, immobilized, incapacitated, etc.  He's only protected from flanking sneaks.  His AC is not as high as I would like it either, so he is still susceptible to Critical hits.  There really wasn't room for Auto Still.  I had to discard Improved Expertise as well.  For those environments where Craft Wand is nerfed then that's your throw-away feat to grab Improved Expertise.

To illustrate the sheer power of a sorcerer when Metamagic is used properly, here is an example of a spell set:
6th: 8 Issacs Greater
7th: 8 Silenced Isaacs Greater
8th: 8 Empowered Isaacs Greater
9th: 8 Maximized Isaacs Greater.
...Just to illustrate pure fire power.  This is why pure and near pure sorcerers are so deadly (and why Monks exist).

@Orion2019 , regarding the BAB and three attacks, that is just happenstance.  I have no plans, nor should anyone really, on trying to capitalize on it.  The AB is dreadfully low to be of any really value.  The idea here is for the Warlock Messiah to use a Mage Staff for good properties, or any martial weapon really.  But good catch on the ESF: Concentration.  I did have it moved in one of my drafts but it must have regressed back when I was trying to fit in Auto Stills.  It should be at Level 27 now.

I will have to correct you on one thing, though.  This is not my first dwarven build since my return.  Let me direct you to the following:  
Dragonwrought Dwarflord
and Runes & Desolation

@conlaoch , you are right about the PM vs Defensive Awareness.  However, PM immunities trump this, IMO, in PvM.  And no, Beamdog hasn't fixed PM spell progression.  It's still on their list so I'm the under impression they want to try and make it a thing.

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
GDL,
This is a nice build. I might swap Stoneskin for Ice Storm since the build already has Epic Warding, Premonition, and Greater Stoneskin to provide DR. This would give it another no save damage dealer at a different spell level.

As for the updates to PM, I've looked at how it's currently implemented. Beamdog would have to change the engine or re-write all the spell scripts. The current exposed function that most default spell scripts use to determine caster level "GetCasterLevel()" simply returns the number of levels in the casting class and has many bugs. This is the reason PM levels aren't counted, and the reason you can't dispel the Bull's Strength from a character with 24 levels of Blackguard.

Re-coding the engine side of the function may be easy or not depending on the data arrangement engine-side.

One of the big overall packages re-wrote all the scripts to make it more like PnP, but that completely re-balances the game (and makes summon spells useless at level 1 due to AI response).
Edit: As @webshaman1 pointed out, this references the PRC.

Fixing PM would open up so many character builds, though.
